turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Kamchatkan languages.
turn.1: What are the main languages of the Kamchatkan people?
turn.2: Kamchatkan languages Kamchatkan (Kamchatic) is a former dialect cluster spoken on the Kamchatka Peninsula.
turn.3: What are the different languages spoken?
turn.4: It now consists of a single language, Western Itelmen (also called Western Kamchadal).
turn.5: Are the languages spoken by different people?
turn.6: It had 100 or fewer speakers in 1991, mostly of the older generation.
turn.7: Are the languages still spoken today?
turn.8: The Russian census of 2010 still reported 80 speakers.
turn.10: There are incomplete records attesting of at least two other divergent varieties, Eastern (also: Northern) Kamchadal and Southern Kamchadal, both extinct in the late 18th century.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Kamchadal languages, though traditionally considered dialects, were apparently distinct enough to be classified as separate languages (Comrie 1981).
